dt: {bc}an act or process in which something {a_link|scatters} or is {a_link|scattered}
{bc}a small number or quantity interspersed here and there
{bc}the random change in direction of the particles constituting a beam or wave front due to collision with particles of the medium traversed

shortdef: an act or process in which something scatters or is scattered
a small number or quantity interspersed here and there

dt: {bc}found or placed far apart and in no order

shortdef: found or placed far apart and in no order

dt: {bc}to sow by casting in all directions {bc}{sx|strew||}
{bc}to cause (a beam of radiation) to diffuse or disperse
{bc}to separate and go in various directions {bc}{sx|disperse||}
{bc}to occur or fall irregularly or at random

pt: {sc}scatter{/sc} {sc}disperse{/sc} {sc}dissipate{/sc} {sc}dispel{/sc} mean to cause to separate or break up. {sc}scatter{/sc} implies a force that drives parts or units irregularly in many directions.
{sc}disperse{/sc} implies a wider separation and a complete breaking up of a mass or group.
{sc}dissipate{/sc} stresses complete disintegration or dissolution and final disappearance.

pt.t: the fog was {it}dissipated{/it} by the morning sun

pt: {sc}dispel{/sc} stresses a driving away or getting rid of as if by scattering.

pt.t: an authoritative statement that {it}dispelled{/it} all doubt

et: Middle English {it}scateren, schateren{/it} to disperse, break up, destroy; akin to Middle Dutch {it}schaderen{/it} to scatter

dt: {bc}a scattering of particles as the result of an elastic collision

shortdef: a scattering of particles as the result of an elastic collision

dt: {bc}a scattering of particles as the result of inelastic collision in which the total kinetic energy of the colliding particles changes

shortdef: a scattering of particles as the result of inelastic collision in which the total kinetic energy of the colliding particles changes

dt: {bc}scattering of light by particles small enough to render the effect selective so that different colors are deflected through different angles

shortdef: scattering of light by particles small enough to render the effect selective so that different colors are deflected through different angles
